required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Post-Market Registry for the Evaluation of the CorPath® GRX System Effectiveness in Peripheral Vascular Interventions

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate real-world performance of the CorPath GRX System in peripheral vascular interventions.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, single-arm, open-label, multi-center registry of the CorPath GRX System to evaluate its real-world performance during peripheral vascular interventions.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Sites have adjusted their participation priorities due to the pandemic. Not enough site interest at this current time to initiate the study.

primary_outcome.description: Successful completion of the robotic-assisted endovascular procedure absent any unplanned conversion to manual for guidewire or balloon/stent catheter inability to navigate vessel anatomy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 hours of the procedure or hospital discharge, whichever occurs first.
primary_outcome.description: <30% residual stenosis in all CorPath System treated lesions at the completion of the interventional procedure in the absence of device-related serious adverse event (SAE).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 hours of the procedure or hospital discharge, whichever occurs first.
primary_outcome.description: A composite of intra- and peri-procedural events, including target vessel rupture, clinically significant perforation or dissection, and distal embolization.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time measured from the insertion of the guiding sheath until the removal of the guiding sheath.
Defined as the total amount of time the procedure is completed using a manual technique.
Defined as the total amount of time the procedure is completed robotically from the robotic cock-pit.
Total fluoroscopy utilized during the procedure as recorded by an Imaging System.
Cumulative dose the operator receives as recorded from an electronic pocket dosimeter during the procedure.
Cumulative dose the staff receives as recorded from an electronic pocket dosimeter during the procedure.
DAP (dose-area-product) and AK (air kerma) as recorded during the procedure.
Total volume of contrast (mL) used during the procedure.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Subjects with a clinical indication for PVI
arm_group.description: Subjects with a clinical indication for Peripheral Vascular Intervention (PVI).

intervention.description: Robotic-assisted (CorPath GRX System) percutaneous vascular interventions.
intervention.arm_group_label: Subjects with a clinical indication for PVI

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with a clinical indication for Peripheral Vascular Intervention (PVI).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥ 18 years.
2. Subject has a clinical indication for Peripheral Vascular Intervention (PVI).
3. Subject is deemed appropriate for robotic-assisted PVI.
4. The subject has been informed of the nature of the study, agrees to its provisions and has provided written informed consent.
5. Individual monitoring of radiation dose, using the pocket dosimeter, was initiated at start of procedure.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Failure/inability/unwillingness to provide informed consent.
2. The investigator determines the subject or the peripheral anatomy is not suitable for ro-botic-assisted PVI.
3. Women who are pregnant.
